examples.description: Designed by Mick Pearce (1996), uses passive cooling inspired by termite mounds with thermal chimneys and stack effect ventilation. Often cited as using 90% less energy than conventional buildings, though this figure is widely repeated without primary sourcing.
examples.source: Unable to verify - requires web search

examples.description: Beddington Zero Energy Development (2002) uses wind cowls and thermal stack ventilation for passive air movement.
examples.source: Unable to verify - requires web search
